result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for work (if confirmed), inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; credit for 2 days (5-16-2015 to 5-17-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Fine is set at ZERO.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time.
No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit; release for work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
First violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 30 days.
Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 40 days.
Third violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 50 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Ray Schaeffer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation, received and filed. LNR

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Stark
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work (if confirmed), inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; credit for 2 days (5-16-2015 to 5-17-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment (can include self-employment). 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 120 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 30 days.
* Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 40 days.
* Third violation of positive drug or alcohol test or possession of drug or drug paraphernalia to serve 50 days.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Letters on behalf of defendant with cover letter received and filed. tk

Defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, the victim  and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Due to court being in trial on another matter, case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.  Any motions due no later than 08-04-2015 by 8:30 am.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 08-04-2015 at 08:30 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Dennis Murphy for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.  
Court ordered the remainder of bail ($400.00) to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Johnny Ray Schaeffer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-9-2015 at 1:30pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/21/2015
